Articles.Content:
Hello guys,

I have only been playing KSP for about 3 weeks now and it is definetly the best 15$ dollars I have spend in a LONG time. I have been having great fun from the start.

I have a background as a private pilot (I learned to pilot a plane at 15yo even before I got my drivers liscences) and I have a bachelor in Physics Eng. (with a useless master but I disgress). Just wanted to point this out because I feel like this game was made for me, with all the true liberty to let your imagination run wild (I have been playing way to much Dwarf fortress anyways) and just a touch of reality so there can be PHYSICS and SCIENCE! in there plus the added flight simulator part (well almost... the aerodynamics dont seem right at times) its just SO great I cant seem to express it properly.

If my english is poor I apologise, my native language is french and I am from QuÃƒÂ©bec.

Just so this is not a complete empty post, here a is picture of my first SSTO plane just reaching orbit.

And one of Jeb enjoying the new seat from 0.2

Regards,

JonhyBee

Edited May 24, 2013 by JonhyBee
Removed potilical comment... sorry about that.

Hello from British Columbia and welcome!

If you want a better aerodynamics model, try the Ferram Aerospace Research mod.

Edited May 24, 2013 by Promii
Removed response to political comment
Thanks! does this mod make it a lot harder or just different? I guess I will have to try it, looks great.
Haha, I guess that comment about Canada was border line political. I just re-read the rules, and fixed it. Sorry about that.

Bienvenue sur les forums KSP! Nice Screenshots by the way and I agree with Promii, the mod he listed will give aircraft and rockets a better aerodynamics model to work with. Hope you keep on enjoying the game and good luck from another newbie.
Wow you're the first other person from Quebec I find on the forums! Welcome aboard! ^^ (My native language is french too btw!)
Some things are easier with Ferram and some are harder. The standard short and fat asparagus-staged rockets that work so well in stock KSP tend to work less well with Ferram, as in real life.

Yeah that's the thing with Ferram: Some rockets will work ten times better, but as soon as you start building on the side, which is something normal in KSP because building up doesn't work well (structural problems, height limitation) you start getting a lot of troubles getting to orbit. Nose cones actually work with the mod, but in overall it can be a lot harder. Rockets from a single central structure, however, will go through the air like an arrow. It's just really different ^^

Wow you're the first other person from Quebec I find on the forums! Welcome aboard! ^^ (My native language is french too btw!)

Faits en un avec la face a Marois dessus, jva le mettre sur le launchpad, mettre le plus gros moteur que je trouve au dessus pi *FOOOOSSSSHH*
And that Kerbal's face just became my official avatar. Its about the face I have when playing this game and achieving something.
Jeb is everyone's favourite. Just DONT KILL HIM. You're gonna really miss him trust me.

Welcome to the forums!

If you ever find yourself in a particularly tricky situation, or if you just want to get some tips to tweak your designs and hone your skills to get more out of your rockets than you're already getting, take a look at the Drawing Board (link in my sig) for some resources you can use. You can also ask questions in the How To forum, or in the International section if you think you'd understand the answers better in your native French.

Happy landings!
Thank you all! First Mun landing (without MechJeb I mean) is done! I blew my engine off on the landing but I am already planning the rescue mission.
